qas.question: What historical period gave the Dominican Order a challenge?
What was it about the Renaissance that gave the Dominican Order problems?
The theologians of what German city gave the Dominican Order resistance?
What writer fused humanism with the Dominican Order teachings?
What Dominican friar celebrated the arts of the Renaissance age?
What did the order not find itself faced with?
What did the order embrace during the the Renaissance?
What theologians of what English city gave the Dominican Order resistance?
What did many Benedictines take part in?
Which friars were celebrated in the science of the Renaissance age?

context: At the same time the order found itself face to face with <a0_0><b5_0>the Renaissance<b5_0/><a0_0/>. <b6_0>It struggled against <a1_0>pagan tendencies<b6_0/><a1_0/> in Renaissance humanism, in Italy through Dominici and Savonarola, in Germany through the theologians of <a2_0><b7_0>Cologne<b7_0/><a2_0/> but it also furnished humanism with such advanced writers as Francesco Colonna (probably the writer of the Hypnerotomachia Poliphili) and <a3_0>Matteo Bandello<a3_0/>. Many Dominicans took part in the <b8_0>artistic activity of the age<b8_0/>, the most prominent being <a4_0><b9_0>Fra Angelico and Fra Bartolomeo<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
